questionData.explanation_of_Question: 句子中有兩個錯誤：1. 主詞 'students' 是複數，動詞 'studies' 應該用原型 'study' (現在式) 或 'studied' (過去式)；2. 時間副詞 'last week' 表示過去時間，所以動詞應該用過去式 'studied'。
questionData.instruction: Identify the error(s) in the sentence above and rewrite it correctly.
questionData.original_sentence: The students studies hard for the exam last week.
standard_corrections: The students studied hard for the exam last week.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 句子中有兩個錯誤：1. 'advise' 是動詞，名詞是 'advice'，且 'advice' 是不可數名詞，不能用不定冠詞 'a'；2. 'difficulty' 作為可數名詞時，複數形式是 'difficulties'。
questionData.instruction: Identify the error(s) in the sentence above and rewrite it correctly.
questionData.original_sentence: I need a advise about job applications; I have many difficulty.
standard_corrections: I need advice about job applications; I have many difficulties.
I need some advice about job applications; I have many difficulties.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 句子中有三個介係詞錯誤：1. 'good at' 而非 'good in'；2. 'afraid of' 而非 'afraid from'；3. 'in public' 而非 'on public'。
questionData.instruction: Identify the error(s) in the sentence above and rewrite it correctly.
questionData.original_sentence: She is good in playing the piano, but she is afraid from performing on public.
standard_corrections: She is good at playing the piano, but she is afraid of performing in public.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 句子中有兩個錯誤：1. 情態動詞 'should' 後面應接動詞原型，不加 'to' 也不用進行式；2. 'want' 後面應接不定詞 'to + 動詞原型'。
questionData.instruction: Identify the error(s) in the sentence above and rewrite it correctly.
questionData.original_sentence: You should to practicing more if you want improving your English.
standard_corrections: You should practice more if you want to improve your English.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 句子中有兩個錯誤：1. 比較級 'more interesting' 用於最高級時應改為 'most interesting'；2. 句尾的代名詞應使用所有格代名詞 'mine'，而非所有格形容詞 'my'。
questionData.instruction: Identify the error(s) in the sentence above and rewrite it correctly.
questionData.original_sentence: This is the more interesting book I have ever read, it is better than my.
standard_corrections: This is the most interesting book I have ever read, it is better than mine.
